newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Visa launches secure Internet payment trial.
newsitem.headline: Visa launches secure Internet payment trial.

text.p: Visa International said on Tuesday it planned to launch a major European pilot project for secure payment card transactions over the Internet.
The project will use encryption technology to allow payment cards to be used securely over open computer networks, it said.

Based on the so-called Secure Electronic Transaction (SET) standard, the scheme will allow consumers and businesses to use Visa payment cards over the Internet with the same security and privacy as in traditional face-to-face situations, it said.
The pilot project will involve 38 Visa members in 16 European countries.
Some of the participating banks will offer secure electronic payment over the Internet and other open networks within six months. Others are due to join the project shortly thereafter.
Visa said a full commercial launch of the system would begin when the pilot scheme was completed in late 1997 or early 1998.

Visa is a worldwide payment card system grouping 20,000 member financial institutions and 13 million locations which accept the card as a means of payment. Some 500 million cards are currently in use around the world.
